Ingredients.1: 2 tablespoons butter, divided, or more as needed

Ingredients.2: 10 medium brown mushrooms, stems removed and diced

Ingredients.3: 3 ounces garden vegetable cream cheese spread (such as Philadelphia(R) Garden Vegetable), or more to taste

Ingredients.5: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh chives, or to taste

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Directions.2: Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add mushroom caps and saute until soft and browned, about 2 1/2 minutes per side. Transfer to a baking dish.

Directions.3: Add diced mushroom stems to the same skillet, adding more butter if needed. Saute until mushrooms have softened, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a bowl along with any pan juices. Add cream cheese, green onions, and chives and mix while still hot. Stuff mixture into the mushroom caps until they are full.

Directions.4: Melt remaining tablespoon butter in a skillet. Add bread crumbs and toss until well coated. Top each mushroom cap with a layer of the buttered crumbs.

Directions.5: Bake in the preheated oven until tops are browned and crispy, about 9 minutes. Remove and let cool for about 3 minutes before serving.
